urls.title: Natural Flood Management work continues on Ilkley Moor
urls.description: Natural Flood Management work continues on Ilkley Moor

tweets.text: We are working with @EnvAgency  and  @FOIM_IlkleyMoor on a natural flood management  project to slow the flow of water from Ilkley Moor into Backstone Beck which flows into the River Wharfe. This work will also help peat bogs to form which store carbon.   https://t.co/Eh3svE5omT https://t.co/TtOAlMqpSr

We‚Äôre looking forward to working closely with our partners to develop 25 innovative projects to respond to flooding across England.

The Flood and Coastal Resilience Innovation Programme will inform our approach to the climate crisis in the run-up to #COP26 and beyond. https://t.co/uLncFImWcY

Our Kent's Magnificent Moths project starts todayüòÄ Working with organisations like @NaturalEngland @Natures_Voice & @EnvAgency this project supported by @HeritageFundUK will help to save some of the UK's rarest and most special moths #mothsmatter @savebutterflies @BCKentBranch https://t.co/H6ukA3tZez

tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids What effect are these gasses having on workers here? What are the @healthandsafety regs? Are the daily exposure limits being exceeded? Perhaps this is a way forward, it is a criminal offence under the Health&safetyAtWorkAct to endanger life in the workplace. @RedIndustries2

@AaronBell4NUL @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL , I am truly aghast. I was certain that the odour nuisance guideline would be exceeded, but to hear that the health-based guidance is exceeded is truly astonishing. To think the residents of Newcastle were vilified for daring to complain, yet science backs them.

So @EnvAgencyMids it took a whopping 13 days of monitoring to discover the WHO 24hr H2S limit is being breached and exceeded by a full 3rd by the gas from #WalleysQuarry. When do we get to see the rest of the data? How often is it breaching the "annoyance" limit? @StinkStopthe

Our latest update to the situation at #WalleysQuarry landfill site is now live.

Read it here üëâ https://t.co/o558iAVicn

#Silverdale #NewcastleUnderLyme https://t.co/NAyB7BIXU0

@EnvAgency 25 years old, what a legacy.

‚ÄúEngland‚Äôs rivers have become nothing more than an extension of the sewage system, polluted, poisoned and exploited for profit." https://t.co/NYtYA46c3g

tweets.text: Officers are attending the scene of a fire at a scrap metal yard in Sheffield, working with @SYFR to manage the risk of pollution from water used to fight the blaze. This includes dye-testing local drains, which may lead to a harmless discolouration to nearby watercourses. https://t.co/EB4mJUxLuA

Wishing the @EnvAgency, a happy 25 years!üéà

We may challenge hard for our client‚Äôs #licences and #permits, push #regulatory boundaries and keep the Agency on their toes, but like any good relationship, ours is built on a solid foundation of mutual respect, built over 20 years! https://t.co/47tvOKkKHc

Very strong smell of slurry coming from the river in the middle of town today. #Frome Reported to the @EnvAgencySW . So long as there is slurry being produced and poured onto land rivers don't have a friggin chance. @RiverActionUK @GeorgeMonbiot @rivercide_live https://t.co/8EVFfOova3

Conceptual models are important visual representations of what lies underground in our rocks & #Hydrogeologists use these models to explain how our #aquifers & #groundwater works. The art is in helping everyone understand what is going on. What makes a good conceptual model? https://t.co/844xClqlWm

Can‚Äôt quite believe it but the @EnvAgency is 25 today! I was there at the start joining as an Assistant Hydrologist. So much has changed (albeit not my taste in shirts) but probably most dramatically and positively the public‚Äôs awareness of the environment & climate.  #ea25years https://t.co/3bxEiEVxZV

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies
domain.description: Interests, opinions, and behaviors of individuals, groups, or cultures; like Speciality Cooking or Theme Parks

tweets.text:
@CattonKelly @EnvAgencyYNE I've met many people over the last few weeks who have been visibly upset by the loss of this green haven - loss of a safe space for daily exercise, loss of contact with greenery, trees, wildlife, loss of a place of peace in a deeply traumatic year.

Let it never be lost again.
@WriterHannahBT @NaturalEngland @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @HeritageFundUK @savebutterflies @BCKentBranch Thanks Hannah. That‚Äôs exactly the response we think moths deserve.
@YorkBikeBelles @EnvAgencyYNE What really? Why would it need to be open to vehicles there? Is that just to make access for flood works easier? Because no need for thru route to anywhere surely?

@suesustainable Maybe the appalling figures released yesterday on the level of sewage dumping by water companies, and the general uselessness of the @EnvAgency in doing anything about it, has shamed them into action - at least while the issue is in the news.

@CattonKelly @EnvAgencyYNE Because, of course, the twin travesty is that it's not just the closure of a crucial walk/cycle route, but the opening of a traffic-free, glorious green route to vehicles for the first time in decades. Shame on all who let this happen!

Ah. Feel much better now. Happy Easter. üòÇ

tweets.text:
How many face coverings did you see littered on your last beach walk?

Litter spoils the places we enjoy and can make its way into the sea and possibly harm marine life.

Bring a bag for your #litter when you go outdoors and take it home to dispose of.

#BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/5XocwdLO82

tweets.text:
@CattonKelly @EnvAgencyYNE From Skeldergate Bridge to just before Room zzz. Sadly, there are no equivalent safe, accessible and direct routes. And certainly no such traffic-free routes that exist in such wonderful harmony with the natural world. 

Ok. Moving on now. Looking forward to June 2022!

tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

urls.title: Essex waste directors sentenced and fined
urls.description: Two company directors have been in the Old Bailey court this week for operating an illegal waste wood operation in Essex.

tweets.text:
One man fined this week and his business partner banned as a company director for illegal #waste wood activity‚Ä¶

READ the whole story‚Ä¶ https://t.co/0G0uqjNXol
#Basildon #Rainham #Essex #LegalNews https://t.co/lP06hB6ICG
@suesustainable @EnvAgencySW @RiverActionUK @GeorgeMonbiot Horrendous Sue. The @EnvAgency ought to be attending and testing. Please let us know if they do or don‚Äôt!
